Uses of Class
com.here.android.mpa.mapping.PositionIndicator

  • Packages that use PositionIndicator 
    Package Description
    com.here.android.mpa.mapping
    The mapping package provides classes, interfaces, and enumerations that display an interactive map, and related functionality that allows your application to create and add map content.
    com.here.android.mpa.venues3d
    This package provides facilities to search and display objects representing three-dimensional views of venues.

    • Uses of PositionIndicator in com.here.android.mpa.mapping

      Methods in com.here.android.mpa.mapping that return PositionIndicator 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PositionIndicator SupportMapFragment.getPositionIndicator()
      Deprecated. 
      Returns the PositionIndicator instance that renders the current position with a marker.
      PositionIndicator Map.getPositionIndicator()
      Returns the PositionIndicator instance that renders the current position with a marker.
      PositionIndicator AndroidXMapFragment.getPositionIndicator()
      Returns the PositionIndicator instance that renders the current position with a marker.
      PositionIndicator MapView.getPositionIndicator()
      Returns the PositionIndicator instance that renders the current position with a marker.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setAccuracyIndicatorColor(int color)
      Sets the color of the accuracy indicator circle using an ARGB (Alpha/Red/Green/Blue) integer color value.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setAccuracyIndicatorVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets a GPS accuracy indicator for the PositionIndicator to be either visible or hidden.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setMarker(Image marker)
      Sets a marker image, overriding the default marker image.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setSmoothPositionChange(boolean isSmooth)
      Sets whether the position indicator changes should be animated.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets a PositionIndicator to be either visible or hidden.
      PositionIndicator PositionIndicator.setZIndex(int index)
      Set the Z index of the position indicator.
